TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AnnotationDocumentPaginator extends System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator

Docs.summary: Provides a for printing a document together with its associated annotations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The AnnotationDocumentPaginator class wraps the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator> specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.
## Examples The following example shows use of the AnnotationDocumentPaginator class.
[!code-cs[DocViewerAnnotationsXps#DocViewAnnXpsPrint](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/DocViewerAnnotationsXps/Window1.xaml.cs#docviewannxpsprint)] [!code-vb[DocViewerAnnotationsXps#DocViewAnnXpsPrint](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/docviewerannotationsxps/window1.xaml.vb#docviewannxpsprint)]
[!code-cs[DocViewerAnnotationsXps#DocViewAnnXpsDocPaginator](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/DocViewerAnnotationsXps/AnnotationsHelperXps.cs#docviewannxpsdocpaginator)] [!code-vb[DocViewerAnnotationsXps#DocViewAnnXpsDocPaginator](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/docviewerannotationsxps/annotationshelperxps.vb#docviewannxpsdocpaginator)]

The annotation storage stream to retrieve the annotations from.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on a specified and annotation storage <xref:System.IO.Stream>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default this constructor sets the text flow direction to <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection>. If needed you can use one of the alternate <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor overloads to set the text <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection> to a different setting.
The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator> class wraps the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator> specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void CancelAsync (object userState);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void CancelAsync(object userState) cil managed

Docs.param: The unique application-defined identifier passed in the call to start the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Cancels all asynchronous operations initiated with a given object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void ComputePageCount ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ComputePageCount() cil managed

Docs.summary: Forces a pagination of the content, updates <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> with the new total, and sets <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> to .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Immediately after ComputePageCount returns, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> will be `true` and the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> property will reflect the total number of pages.
The number of pages may change if the annotation content is modified or the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A> is changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void ComputePageCountAsync (object userState);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ComputePageCountAsync(object userState) cil managed

Docs.param: An application-defined object for identifying the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Starts an asynchronous pagination of the content, updates <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> with the new total, and sets <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> to when it is finished.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `userState` parameter is intended for use with <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.CancelAsync%2A> method if the application wishes to cancel the asynchronous operation before completion.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage GetPage (int pageNumber);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage GetPage(int32 pageNumber) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based page number of the to return.
Docs.summary: Returns a together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.
Docs.returns: The for the specified ; or , if the specified does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetPageAsync (int pageNumber, object userState);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void GetPageAsync(int32 pageNumber, object userState) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based page number of the to retrieve.
An application-defined object that is used to identify the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Asynchronously returns a together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `userState` parameter is intended for use with <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.CancelAsync%2A> method if the application wishes to cancel the asynchronous operation before completion.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool IsPageCountValid { get; }
.property instance bool IsPageCountValid

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> is the total number of pages.
Docs.value: if pagination is complete and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> represents the total number of pages; otherwise, if pagination is in process and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> represents the number of pages currently formatted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks IsPageCountValid may switch from `true` to `false` and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> recomputed if a change to the content or <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A> triggers repagination.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int PageCount { get; }
.property instance int32 PageCount

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the number of pages currently formatted.
Docs.value: If <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> is , the total number of annotation pages; otherwise if <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> is , the number of pages currently formatted (pagination in process).

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> may change from `true` to `false` and PageCount recomputed if a change to the content or <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A> triggers repagination.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Size PageSize { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Windows.Size PageSize

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the suggested width and height of each page.
Docs.value: The suggested width and height for formatting pages.

remarks.format: ## Remarks PageSize gets or sets the *suggested* size for formatting pages. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Size%2A> property to get the actual size of the page (if it is required the actual size may be cropped from the suggested PageSize).

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Documents.IDocumentPaginatorSource Source { get; }
.property instance class System.Windows.Documents.IDocumentPaginatorSource Source

Docs.summary: Gets the source document that is being paginated.
Docs.value: The source document that is being paginated.
